meaning: (v. & n.) To express happiness with your face
example: The baby smiled at her mother.

meaning: (n.) A person you like and enjoy spending time with
example: My best friend lives next door.

meaning: (v.) To engage in activity for fun
example: The children play in the park every afternoon.

meaning: (n.) Things that people and animals eat
example: The food in this restaurant is delicious.

meaning: (v.) To rest with your eyes closed
example: Most people sleep for eight hours each night.

meaning: (adj.) Having or giving out a moderate degree of heat
example: The warm sun felt nice on her face.

meaning: (adj. & v.) Free from dirt; to make something free from dirt
example: Please clean your room before dinner.
She was too busy to answer the phone.

meaning: (v.) To make it easier for someone to do something
example: Can you help me carry these bags?
The kind neighbor brought us cookies.
Students learn new things every day at school.
She lives in a small apartment.

meaning: (adj.) In an early stage of life or growth
example: The young puppy was full of energy.

meaning: (v.) To look at and understand written words
example: She likes to read books before bedtime.
They walk to school every morning.
He took a quick shower before work.
The test was very easy for her.
The happy children played in the garden.
The cold wind made her shiver.

meaning: (v.) To pay attention to someone or something you can hear
example: Please listen carefully to the instructions.

meaning: (v.) To form letters or words on a surface
example: She writes in her diary every night.

meaning: (v. & adj.) To make something not closed; not closed
example: Please open the window for fresh air.

meaning: (v. & adj.) To make something not open; near
example: Don't forget to close the door.
The library must be quiet so people can study.
She bought a new car last week.

meaning: (n.) A departure from what is normal or expected
example: The sudden drop in temperature was an aberration for that time of year.
The belligerent customer demanded to speak to the manager.

meaning: (adj.) Done in secret or kept hidden
example: They held clandestine meetings in the basement.
The chef's deft hands quickly chopped the vegetables.
The ebullient child bounced around the playground.
The fastidious editor caught every small error.
The garrulous passenger talked throughout the entire flight.
The books were arranged in a haphazard manner on the shelves.
His impetuous decision to quit his job caused problems later.

meaning: (v.) To place things side by side for comparison
example: The artist juxtaposed bright and dark colors in the painting.
She had a keen interest in marine biology.
The lackadaisical student rarely completed homework on time.
A wave of melancholy swept over her as she packed her childhood home.
He remained nonchalant despite the pressure of the deadline.
The mansion's ostentatious decoration reflected the owner's wealth.
The pedantic professor corrected every small grammatical error.
The small café was the quintessential Parisian breakfast spot.

meaning: (adj.) Not revealing one's thoughts or feelings readily
example: The reticent witness was reluctant to share details.

meaning: (adj.) Kept secret, especially for wrong reasons
example: He took a surreptitious glance at his neighbor's test.
The taciturn farmer spoke only when necessary.
Smartphones have become ubiquitous in modern life.
She continued to vacillate between the two job offers.

meaning: (n.) A turning point in history or affairs
example: The invention of the internet was a watershed moment in communication.
The xenial hosts made everyone feel welcome at the party.

meaning: (v.) To have an intense longing for something
example: She yearned for her childhood home in the countryside.
She approached her studies with tremendous zeal.
He felt ambivalent about changing jobs.
The speaker was praised for the brevity of his speech.
She was cognizant of the risks involved in the experiment.
The diligent student reviewed her notes every evening.
His eloquent defense convinced the jury.
The fervid sports fans cheered throughout the game.
The gallant firefighter rescued the child from the burning building.

meaning: (n.) Something that signals what is to come
example: The dark clouds were a harbinger of the approaching storm.
These plants are indigenous to the Amazon rainforest.
The jubilant team celebrated their victory.

meaning: (adj.) Relating to or caused by motion
example: The kinetic sculpture moved with the wind.
The hot weather made everyone feel lethargic.
The magnanimous winner shared his prize with the runner-up.
The detective uncovered their nefarious plot.

meaning: (adj.) No longer in use or out of date
example: The old computer system had become obsolete.
She had a penchant for chocolate desserts.

meaning: (n.) A state of uncertainty or confusion
example: He was in a quandary about which job offer to accept.

meaning: (adj.) Able to recover quickly from difficulties
example: The resilient city quickly rebuilt after the earthquake.
The old sage offered valuable advice to the young leader.
The tenacious climber never gave up on reaching the summit.
Coffee shops have become ubiquitous in cities.
The verdant valley was full of lush plants.
The wary cat approached the unfamiliar dog slowly.
Cacti are adapted to xeric conditions in the desert.

meaning: (n.) A calculating device with beads or counters
example: The teacher taught basic arithmetic using an abacus.
The benign tumor was not dangerous to the patient's health.
The cacophony of city traffic made it hard to concentrate.

meaning: (n.) Skill in performing tasks with the hands
example: The surgeon's dexterity was impressive during the operation.

meaning: (adj.) Lasting for a very short time
example: The beauty of cherry blossoms is ephemeral, lasting only a few days.

meaning: (n.) The front of a building; a deceptive appearance
example: Behind the elegant facade, the building was in need of repair.
Her gregarious nature made her the life of every party.
The different communities lived together in perfect harmony.

meaning: (v.) To light up; to explain clearly
example: The professor's explanation helped to illuminate the complex concept.
The jovial host made everyone feel welcome at the party.

meaning: (v.) To start a fire; to inspire
example: The teacher's passion helped to kindle students' interest in science.
Her lucid explanation made the complex theory accessible to everyone.
The river meandered through the peaceful valley.
As a novice cook, she started with simple recipes.
The opulent palace was decorated with gold and precious stones.
The placid lake surface reflected the mountains like a mirror.
The cold water helped quench his thirst after the long run.
The robust economy continued to grow despite global challenges.
The serene mountain landscape brought peace to her mind.
The tranquil garden was perfect for meditation.

meaning: (n.) A device that protects against rain
example: He opened his umbrella as the rain began to fall.
She had vivid memories of her childhood summers.
The children whispered secrets during class.
The xenial hosts made all their guests feel at home.
The farm yielded an excellent crop that year.
The whimsical decorations turned the garden into a fairy wonderland.
The zealous fan collected every album the band had ever released.

meaning: (adj.) Having a huge appetite; very eager
example: She was a voracious reader who finished a book every day.
The taciturn farmer rarely spoke more than a few words.

meaning: (n.) The state of being calm and peaceful
example: The mountain retreat offered perfect serenity away from city life.

meaning: (n.) The ability to recover quickly from difficulties
example: Her resilience helped her overcome many challenges in life.
His quixotic plan to solve world hunger in a year was admirable but unrealistic.
The actress was known for her pulchritudinous appearance.

meaning: (v.) To make something unclear or difficult to understand
example: The politician tried to obfuscate the truth during the interview.

meaning: (n.) The lowest point in a person's fortunes
example: The bankruptcy was the nadir of his business career.

meaning: (adj.) Sweet or musical; pleasant to hear
example: The singer's mellifluous voice captivated the audience.

meaning: (n.) A person who inspires or influences others
example: The scientist was a luminary in the field of physics.

meaning: (n.) A constantly changing pattern or sequence of elements
example: The city was a kaleidoscope of colors and sounds.

meaning: (n.) The act of placing things side by side for comparison
example: The juxtaposition of the two paintings highlighted their differences.

meaning: (adj.) Incapable of being tired out; tireless
example: The indefatigable athlete trained for hours every day.

meaning: (adj.) Excessively talkative, especially on trivial matters
example: The garrulous old man told stories for hours.
